Mehrali is the only worker in his family, and his income is not enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Mehrali applied for 1200 AZN to purchase one dairy cow and fodder. This will be his third loan from AqroInvest. Mehrali has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy one dairy cow and fodder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy six sheep to rear.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is 57 years old and is married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. Herminia runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional grocery items to sell.

Herminia has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from "nipa" making (woven palm mats use for house construction and repair). Herminia aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery items to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 56-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married to Ilham, his soul mate and the mother of his two children, of whom one is working and the other is still attending school. Despite his older age, Ali is obliged to work continually as he is the breadwinner, responsible for covering his family expenses, especially his child’s education fees. 

Ali owns an orchard, where he provides his customers a great quantity of fresh fruits. He has been involved in this occupation since 1992. He suffers from a bad financial situation.  That’s why he’s asking today for a loan from Ameen s.a.l, a Kiva partner, to improve his business by purchasing an electrical generator for the well to irrigate the trees and increase his productivity. He believes that this Kiva loan will also allow him to offer a greater quality of products and thus improve his income by minimum of 30%.

loans.use: to improve his orchard by purchasing an electrical generator for the well.

loans.name: Nabil

texts.en: Nabil is a 53-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and three school-age children. With the cooperation of his wife, he is able to satisfy his family's needs and offer them a fair way of living.  Nabil owns a small mini-market where he sells all kinds of dairy and daily products in addition to soft drinks and many other products. As for his wife, she works as a teacher to help him cover their family expenses. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed quantity of food provisions for his mini-market. In that way he will be able to diversify his inventory and therefore increase his revenues and his standard of living. Nabil looks forward to expanding his grocery, waiting for the perfect time to open other branches and assign his children to ownership of these branches.

loans.use: to purchase the needed quantity of food provisions for his mini-market.

loans.name: Flavia Domitila

texts.es:
La Señora. Flavia es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Bankito la Ramada, vive por una comunidad que pertenece al cantón Nabón, lugar que tiene accidentada geografía la cual le da un clima frió y grandes extensiones para disfrutar de la naturaleza fuera de la rutina de la ciudad. Su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad a ejercer varias actividades económicas, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Flavia tiene 33 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos (gemelos) de 4 meses de edad, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su padre pero independiente. 

Nuestra socia se dedica a las labores del campo en donde trabaja cultivando hortalizas las que las vende en su comunidad, también cría y vende cuyes, gallinas y cerdos. 

Este es el tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir comprando semillas, abono y animales.
 
Su sueño es llegar a tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Flavia is a member of the 'Nuevo Bankito la Ramada' community bank.  She lives in a community in Nabón canton.  This area has a very rugged landscape.  It is a cold-climate area and has large tracts of land where people can enjoy nature and escape the daily city routine.  The locals raise animals and farm.  In addition, many of them travel to the city every day in order to carry out different business activities.  They still maintain the culture and traditions of their ancestors.

Flavia is 33 years old and the single mother of 4-month-old twins.  She does not own her own home.  She lives in her father's house but independently.

Our member works in agriculture, growing vegetables which she sells in her community.  She also raises and sells guinea pigs, hens and pigs.

This is Flavia's third loan as a member of her community bank and she will invest it in buying seeds, fertilizer and animals.  Her dream is to own her own home.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and animals

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es: Ana de 22 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, esta joven trabajadora vive en Milagros en la casa de sus padres ya que es soltera. La actividad que desempeña le gusto desde que comenzó a estudiar ya que es buena en las ventas y decidió probar el mercado. Antes de salir de la secundaria había asistido a varios cursos en los cuales aprendió técnica para el cuidado y mantenimiento del mismo. Lleva 7 años dedicándose a este negocio y le va muy bien, realiza lo que es tinturado, alisado, cortes, manicura lo que el cliente le solicite. Realiza el trabajo visitando a sus cliente previa cita ya que no a podido adecuar un local lo cual no es problema porque igual tiene clientes. Ana comenta que su mayor problema es la delincuencia ya que para dar el servicio lleva una maleta con los productos y los utensilios que utiliza como plancha y secadora de cabello, pero de momento no ha sufrido robos y espera continuar así. El préstamo que está solicitando es para la compra de productos de belleza como esmaltes, acetona, cremas, tintes, etc., y una parte para arreglar su cuarto en la casa de sus padres. A futuro le gustaría culminar sus estudios universitarios y abrir su gabinete de belleza.
texts.en:
Ana, 22, sells beauty products.  This young, hardworking woman lives in Milagros in her parents’ house since she’s single.  She’s liked the activity she carries out since she started going to school since she’s good at sales and decided to test the market.  Before finishing secondary school she’d taken several courses where she learned to care for and maintain it.  

She’s been in this business for seven years now and does very well.  She does hair coloring, straightening, haircuts and manicure; whatever the customer requests.  She does the work visiting the customer based on prior appointments because she’s not been able to set up a salon which hasn’t been a problem, though, since she has customers anyway.

Ana comments that her greatest problem is crime because she has to carry a suitcase filled with her products and tools like hair straightening comb and hair dryer in order to do her work but to date she’s not been robbed and hopes to continue that way.

The loan she’s asking for is to buy beauty products like nail polish, acetone, creams, and hair color, etc. and part of it is to fix up her room in her parents’ house.  In the future she’d like to finish her university studies and open her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy nail polish, acetone, creams and hair color.

loans.name: Patrocinia

texts.en:
Patrocinia is a hardworking entrepreneur. She operates a business, buying and selling of fruits and vegetables in the Philippines. Patrocinia has been in this business for 25 years. In addition, Patrocinia earns more income from a general store and raising pigs.

She is borrowing 50,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional items to stock and sell in her fruits and vegetables business like mangoes, banana, water melon, apple, oranges, cabbage, carrots, squash, string beans and spices. Patrocinia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  

In the future, she hopes to build and expand her business so that she can secure her family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase mangoes, banana, water melon, apple, oranges, cabbage, carrots, squash, string beans and spices to sell

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 32 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Mary Ann works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Ann runs a silver jewelry retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of silver jewelry.

Mary Ann has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Mary Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks of silver jewelry

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy  modern blo-dry,hair drier , and shampoos and chemicals for treating hair

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en:
Hadija, 23, has two school going children.  Previously she worked in the home of a family and gradually saved enough money to open a small business. This way she became independent, and thanks to her sales strategy, she grew her sales and profits.

She is a very hardworking person and works every day in her small store.  Her income helps her give her children everything they need.

Hadija is requesting a loan to buy vegetables, sacks of potatoes and tomatoes. She is grateful to Yehu Microfinance for the opportunity it is giving her; it is very important support because the loan is the only opportunity she has to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, sacks of potatoes and tomatoes.

loans.name: Tehran

texts.en:
Tehran is 56-year-old man, an Internally Displaced Person who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and one son. He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the past 25 years. He chose this business because it is profitable, and a fresh crop is in high demand. People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy; many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits serve every table in Azerbaijan households and also make fresh punch.

Tehran sells his crop in the Bilasuvar central bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN. His wife actively helps him to raise his crops.

As his products are in high demand, Tehran wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand. For this purpose he applied for a loan of 700 AZN.  He will buy seeds and fertilizers. This will be his third loan, and he has a positive loan history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Nyadzua

texts.en:
Nyadzua has been a merchant for more than 4 years. She has a well-stocked store in her house, located in Samburu in the city of Mombasa.

Nyadzua is a very hardworking and dedicated woman. She is married to Karisa and they have 3 children, two of whom attend school thanks to the hard work and effort that they have put in each day to get ahead.

She started out very modestly with a small store that she used to have in her mother's house. Now, thanks to God, she has her own business. She thanks the Yehu Microfinance for the trust they have placed in her and the support that they are providing.

She is requesting a loan to stock her business with sugar, tea, soft drinks, bakery products, and other items, because in this way she will have a well-stocked business.

loans.use: to stock her business with sugar, tea, soft drinks, bakery products, and other items.

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en:
Elchin is 36 years old man, IDP, who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and two children. 

He is farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the past 10 years.  During these years Elchin gained enough skills and experience to run his business. He chose this crop business because it is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. 

People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy.  Many national dishes are made with vegetables, like pilau and dolma.  .He raise pears, apples, peaches, plums, pomegranates, cucumbers, tomatoes, carrot and potatoes.   He usually sells his crop in the central bazaar.  His monthly income is 250 AZN.

Ashis products are in high demand, Elchin wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demands.  For this reason he applied for 1500 AZN loan.  He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.  This will be his second loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Chhay

texts.en:
Chhay is a diligent man, living with his family in Baray district of Kompong Tom province.  To support family, Chhay works hard in his rice field and trades firewood for extra income. 

Chhay usually collects firewood around his commune with his cow-pulled trailer or purchases some from suppliers, and then he continually transports them to marketplaces.  He is able to make around $8 per day, which he uses to spend on food, clothes, and allowances for his three school-aged children.

At the present, Chhay is asking for a first cycle loan of $1000 to purchase a strong cow for both farming and firewood business. vThis loan will help him improve his businesses activities and he hopes to make a good income in coming years. 

Later Chhay plans to purchase farm supplies such plowing and rice mill machines for use use on his farm.  Chhay seeks to ensure a good education for all of his children.

loans.use: to purchase a strong cow.

loans.name: Asaf

texts.en:
Asaf is a 41-year-old man, married with three children. He is IDP and lives with his family in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. He breeds cows and cattle and sells milk and milk products as well as cattle for meat purposes to local butchers. He also raises sheep for meat purposes. Asaf has 10 years of experience in this field thanks to his father who taught him how to look after cattle. He receives 120 AZN financial support from government monthly, but this is too little to cover his family's needs.

Asaf usually buys small cattle, raises and fattens them in 5-6 months, and resells them for a higher price in the local livestock bazaar. He sells milk and yoghurt to the neighbors. Selling milk and meat brings 280 AZN per month. Milk and yoghurt, as well as beef and mutton, are very popular products in Azerbaijan. People use meat in everyday national dishes such as pilau and dolma and always use yoghurt souse. Milk products are considered very healthy and are also present in everyday life.   

Asaf is the only earner in his family, and he doesn't earn enough to cover the basic needs of his beloved children. Asaf applied for 1,000 AZN to purchase two cattle, one dairy cow, and fodder. This will be his second loan and he has good client history.

loans.use: to buy two cattle, one dairy cow, and fodder.

loans.name: Anselmo

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 6 filhos dos apenas 4 frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta sua sogra enviando dinheiro para ajudar nas despesas.
É motorista, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (ferro, areia, cimento, barrotes, e outros) para dar continuidade a obra da sua barraca.
No futuro deseja concluir a sua barraca para dar início as vendas, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo devidamente para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o elevado custo e o alto preço dos produtos.
texts.en:
He's married and has six children, only four of which attend school. He lives in a house he owns and also supports his mother-in-law by sending money to help pay for her expenses.
He's a driver. With the current loan he intends to purchase construction supplies (iron, sand, cement, beams, etc.) in order to continue building his stall.
In the future he wishes to finish building his stall so that he can start selling. For that reason he pledges to repay the loan as scheduled, so he can request more loans from Hluvuku.
His challenge is high expenses and the high price of the products.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (iron, sand, cement, beams, etc.) in order to continue building his stall.

loans.name: Geoconda Anays

texts.es: Geoconda es una mujer divorciada de 27 años que ha superado sus problemas matrimoniales y se dedica a un negocio muy particular. En su domicilio ubicado en la Orquídeas mantiene un negocio de venta de tanques. Empezó este negocio cuando trabajaba en una fábrica en la cual compraban este producto, salir comenzó preguntando en las grandes lubricadoras ya que ellas compran aceite a granel si le vendían los tanques vacios, para su sorpresa pocas empresa sabían que compran los tanque por lo que en ocasiones llegaron a regalárselos. Es un negocio rentable ya que ella es únicamente quien termina la transacción. No tiene horario determinado ya que empieza su venta cuando tiene varios tanques. Como tiene 2 hijos menores de edad también se ayuda en sus gastos brindando el servicio de expreso escolar. El crédito que solicita es para tener dinero cuando necesite comprar tanques para la venta.
texts.en:
Geoconda, 27, is a divorced woman who has overcome her marital problems and is in a very particular line of work.  She sells empty oil drums at home in Orquídeas.  She started this business when she used to work in a factory that purchased this type of product.  She started asking around at the big oil change and lubrication firms that buy oil in bulk if they sold the empty drums.  Much to her surprise few of the firms were aware that the drums could be sold and sometimes even gave them to her for free.

It’s a profitable business because she’s the only one to do the transaction.  She does not have a fixed schedule since she starts to sell when she has several drums available.  Since she has two minor children she also helps herself cover expenses by providing school transportation services.  She’s asking for the loan to have money on hand when she needs to buy tanks to sell.

loans.use: to buy empty oil drums.

loans.name: Elvis Daniel

texts.es: Elvis continua viviendo en el Suburbio de Guayaquil, ahora con sus 52 años continua soltero, mantiene la relacion con sus 3 hijos quienes son independientes. Su profesión desde hace 13 años es ser maestro albañil empezando cuando tenía 16 años cuando empezó como ayudante donde aprendió todo lo referente a la construcción. A partir de los 19 años empezó por cuenta propia dando a conocer su trabajo, en la actualidad tiene sus propias obras y trabaja con un ayudante. Su horario es de lunes a sábado ya que el domingo es para el descanso, esto es porque su desempeño radica en la fuerza física. El único inconveniente en su trabajo es la temporada de invierno en la cual tiene poco trabajo. El préstamo que solicita Elvis es para terminar la construcción de su casa con la compra de arena, cemento, piedra y el papeleo para la escritura de la misma, como es albañil su sueño es tener una casa con una hermosos acabados.
texts.en:
Elvis continues living in El Suburbio in Guayaquil.  At the age of 52 he’s single but he maintains a relationship with his three children who are independent.  

His profession for the last 13 years has been master builder.  He started at the age of 16 working as an assistant where he learned everything related to construction.  From the age of 19 on he started working for himself making his work known.  He currently has his own work projects and he works with an assistant.  His schedule is Monday through Saturday since Sunday is to rest because his work depends on physical strength.  The only inconvenience with his work is that there is little of it in winter.  

The loan Elvis is requesting is to finish building a house.  He will buy sand, cement, stone and pay the fees related to the house’s title.  As a construction worker, his dream is to own a house with beautiful finishing touches.

loans.use: to purchase cement, rocks, and bricks to improve his home

loans.name: María Ercilia

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Bankito la Ramada, vive por una comunidad que pertenece al cantón Nabón, lugar que tiene accidentada geografía la cual le da un clima frió y grandes extensiones para disfrutar de la naturaleza fuera de la rutina de la ciudad. Su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y muchos salen diariamente a la ciudad a ejercer varias actividades económicas, aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora María tiene 42 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 7 hijos  de 23, 20, 17, 16, 12, 9 y 8 años de edad, su primera hija es casada y vive  independiente, sus cuatro hijos siguientes son discapacitados y sus dos últimos hijos están en una escuelita de la ciudad.
 
Doña María se dedica a la agricultura y lo que cosecha lo vende en su comunidad, cría y vende animales como son: ganado, cuyes, cerdos, pollos, también se dedica al bordado de polleras y bufandas aprendiendo esta actividad por habilidad.
 
Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir comprando animales, alimento de animales, abono y semillas para sus cultivos.

Sus sueños son mejorar su casa y darles estudios a sus hijos quienes por su discapacidad no han podido hacer.
texts.en:
María is a member of the communal bank Nuevo Bankito La Ramada. She lives in a community which belongs to the canton of Nabón, a place of rugged terrain, cold weather, and large stretches of land where you can enjoy nature away from the city routine. Its people work raising animals, farming, and many go out daily to the city to work different jobs. They still maintain the culture and traditions of their peoples.

María is 42 years old, married, and has born seven children from her marriage. They are 23, 20, 17, 16, 12, 9, and 8 years old. Her oldest daughter is married and lives away from home, her next four children are disabled, and the two youngest go to a little school in town. 

María works in agriculture and sells what she harvests to the community. She raises and sells animals, such as livestock, Guinea pigs, pigs, and  chickens. She also works embroidering skirts and scarves, which she learned due to her skill.
 
She has been a member of the communal bank for three years, and will invest her new loan in the purchase of animals, animal feed, fertilizer, and seeds for her crops.

Her dreams are to improve her home and to give her children a good education, which they haven't been able to have due to their disability.

loans.use: to purchase animals, animal feed, fertilizer, and seeds.

loans.name: Anelor

texts.en:
Anelor is 37 years old and is married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. Anelor runs a sari-sari (retail) store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy groceries to sell in her store.

Anelor has been in this business for three years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy groceries to sell in her sari-sari (retail) store

loans.name: Sadek

texts.en: Sadek is a 19-year-old Lebanese man. He’s single, living with his father and one relative. He and his father are trying their best to bring added income to the family and enhance their way of living. He has been working as a blacksmith for a  few years. He learned this profession from his father and he's doing the best he can to improve and develop himself. Despite his tough work, and in order to better support his father, Sadek also works at a local minimarket.  As he wants to enlarge his business, he decided to take a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase needed metal supplies to carry on his work in a proper way. Sadek wishes to get married and have children; these are the reasons why he’s in real need: to increase his income in order to set aside the needed savings for his wedding and future life plans.

loans.use: to purchase needed metal supplies.

loans.name: Emelia

texts.en:
Emelia is married with 5 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emelia is 47 years old and has one child remaining that currently goes to school.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Emelia requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle.

She has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Emelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for her motorcycle

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 26 year old married man who lives in Lebanon with his wife and child, who is school age.  He is friendly and above all a hardworking man.  Mohammad manages the family’s expenses while operating his business. 

Mohammad owns a car spare parts shop where he sells used spare parts at low prices to let his customers avoid buying new ones at high prices. He always seeks to improve his business and gain added customers. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to buy added spare parts for his business.  After getting this loan, he confirms that it will help him increase his sales thus his income. 

One of his greatest dreams is to improve his work and collect money to enable his son to get an excellent education and help him live a very comfortable life, away from bad life circumstances.

loans.use: to buy added spare parts.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to boost his meat goat business. With the loan, he wants to purchase meat goat for resale and make good profits to help him to get ahead in life. Thanks for Yehu and Kiva lenders for giving him an opportunity to access loans.

loans.use: to purchase meat goat for sale.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 27-year-old man. He’s single and lives in Lebanon with his parents and three siblings. Two of them are working in addition to their father who is considered the main income provider for the family. Despite his young age, Hasan is obliged to work continually as he thinks to have his own family and children. Hasan has been working in the construction field since 2008. He’s specialized in floor covering and has gained a fair number of clients asking for his services. Regardless of being satisfied with what he has attained so far, he suffers from a bad financial situation; that’s why he’s asking today for a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to improve his business by purchasing new construction tools as he plans to keep offering the best quality of work. In the near future, Hasan plans to take added loans to open his own paves shop. He works really hard to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to improve his business by purchasing new construction tools.

loans.name: Roeung

texts.en:
Roeung is 24 years old, married, and has a lovely young child. Roeung is a rice farmer like other villagers. She cultivates rice for the family’s daily food while her husband works in a small restaurant in Phnom Penh to provide the family with income. Aside from her rice farming business, Roeung wants to help her husband earn income by selling grocery items.

Due to inadequate capital, Roeung would like to take out a loan in the amount of USD 1,500 to purchase merchandise to sell in her small convenience shop such as canned food, spices, soft drinks, sweets, cigarettes, biscuits, and other household products. With the help of this loan, Roeung will be able to start up a new business, which allows her to make additional income to raise her children and provide basic necessities.

loans.use: to purchase canned food, spices, soft drinks, sweets, cigarettes, biscuits, and other household products.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: This is Ali, 39, a resident of Lebanon. He is married to Afifeh, the mother of his two children who are still attending school. Ali supports his family with pleasure and he’s ready to give help whenever they need it. It’s an adorable family, for which he’s ready to sacrifice his life.  He has owned a van for the past four years. His job consists of transporting his customers from town to town. He works independently on a free-lance basis. In parallel, he works at a local company on his free time. Ali is a friendly and punctual person which attracts added customers. Today, he needs to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the needed maintenance on his van. This loan will allow him to carry on his job properly. The most important thing is transporting his clients safely without facing problems. Ali has some great ideas for the future to improve his work and he’s planning to complete these ideas once he has the chance.

loans.use: to perform the needed maintenance on his van.

loans.name: Ng'ombe

texts.en:
With her previous credit Kiva loan, Ng'ombe bought bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar, for the retail shop that she sold, increasing her working capital slightly. Now she is applying for a new credit Kiva loan, because her sellers have requested more products. She has an established clientele, and Ng'ombe's working capital is insufficient to meet the growth in demand.

This is the reason why her credit Kiva loan will be successful, because she will respond to demand by buying sacks of charcoal at a good price. Ng'ombe tells the lenders that her credit Kiva loans have been very useful to her. She says thank you, and may they continue helping her.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 28 years old, married and blessed with two children. She manages a motorbike business as well as a grocery shop. She ventured into this business eight years ago and earns a monthly income of 12,000 KES.

Christine wants to buy another motorbike for her business and has requested a fourth loan of 80,000 KES from KADET after paying off the previous loans successfully. The profits she earns will be plowed back into her businesses. Her dreams are to see her children get good educations as well as own a car one day.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Tony

texts.en: Tony is a 32-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and one school-aged child. They live in a modest house located in a beautiful Lebanese village. Tony has spent the last ten years fixing electricity for homes. However, he’s not the only one covering the family expenses. His wife, who works at a bakery, earns a good amount of income for their family as well. Tony has always wanted to better develop his business and improve his work, but until now, he has not had enough money. For that reason, he has decided to take out a loan from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to renew his electrical equipment. He says that the loan will help him increase his sales, including his income, by 15%. Since Tony works independently, he wishes to have his own electrical equipment shop soon in order to keep paying his family's expenses.

loans.use: To renew his electrical equipment

loans.name: Nueva Generación  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nueva Generación está formada por 7 socias quienes viven por una comunidad que pertenece a la parroquia Turi en Cuenca, esta parroquia es reconocida por ser el mirador de la Ciudad de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y comercio. Nuestras socias son personas amables, gentiles y de un corazón cálido, su mayor característica es la de ser mujeres luchadoras que laboran día a día para el beneficio de sus hogares y para sacar adelante a sus familias.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Enma, tiene 54 años, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos, dos de ellos son casados y viven independientes y sus dos hijas solteras una de ellas estudia en la universidad y otra esta en un colegio de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señora Enma se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y para solventar los gastos de su hogar es comerciante, esta actividad la desempeña hace 4 años y labora 4 días de la semana sin horario fijo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y productos naturales y vende ambulantemente, también se dedica a la cría y venta de animales y a la agricultura, sus cosechas son para su consumo y para la venta.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 años, su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir comprando productos naturales y ropa para continuar con su negocio.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomó la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
The 'Nueva Generación' community bank has seven [female] members who live in a community in Turi parish, in Cuenca.  This parish is known as the viewpoint of the city of Cuenca.  The locals raise animals, farm and work in commerce.  Our members are friendly, kind, warm-hearted people.  Above all, they are tenacious women who work hard every day for the well-being of their households, so that they can provide for their families.

One of the members of this group is 54-year-old Enma.  Enma is a widow and has four children from her marriage.  Two of her children are married and live independently.  She also has two single daughters.  One of her daughters is studying at university and the other attends a high school in the city.  Enma does not own her own home but lives in rental accommodation.  

Enma takes care of her housework and, in order to cover her household expenses, she works as a saleswoman.  She has been in her business for four years and works four days a week.  She does not work fixed hours.  Enma's business is selling clothing and natural products.  She makes her sales as an street vendor.  She also raises and sells animals, and farms.  Some of her harvested crops are for her family's own consumption and some are sold on the market.

Enma has been a member of her community bank for three years.  She will invest her new loan in buying natural products and clothing so that she can continue in her business.  Her dream is to own her own home.

The small photo is of a member who was not able to be present when the group photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy natural products and clothing

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is requesting a loan of $600 to improve her business. She is making a good income and with the loan, she will be able to buy more things to keep in her store. She is happy with the loan that is offered.

loans.use: To buy coffee, sugar, cigarettes, and other items to sell

loans.name: Tuon's Group

texts.en:
Tuon is 57 years old.  She is a widow and has four children.  Although all of her children are married, three of them still need her support.  Her main income is earned from fishing, including finding edible snails in the river to sell.  She has been in business for 20 years.

She took her first loan with VisionFund in 2011 and has completely repaid the entire loan.  The past loan enabled Tuon to meet her current needs as well as to set aside some money for future needs.  Now, she can earn up to about $4 per day.  As a result, she is confidently leading a group consisting of herself and  four members.  Three of the members are applying for loans of 1,000,000 KHR each while another member is requesting a loan of 700,000 KHR.  Tuon, the group leader, wants to use her portion of the loan to buy a small boat, which will be used to find the edible snails she sells.  She hopes to find more snails and sell at a high price so that she can earn more income to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy a small boat, which will be used to find the edible snails she sells.

loans.name: Eth

texts.en:
Eth is 44 years old and has been farming for the past 33 years. She grows rice, potatoes and vegetables to sell, as well as raising pigs both for slaughter and to sell their offspring. Eth is happy because she has a good husband who helps her in these ventures, and her income is a great help in sending her three children to school.

Eth wants to ensure a good harvest, so she is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 KHR from HKL to hire laborers to work on her farm and to purchase feed for her pigs. She hopes that through her loan and the experience she gains from her day-to-day work, she can earn a better income. She wishes to thank her lenders in advance for their assistance.

loans.use: to hire laborers to work on her farm and purchase feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline lives in Samburu in the city of Mombasa. She has operated her store for the past seven years. She is a very hardworking, enterprising person who always strives to the maximum degree to be able to help her family members and to give them everything they need to have a life with no hardships or unmet needs.

Jackline is applying for a 40000 KES loan from Yehu to buy supplies to stock her store with beverages, canned and baked goods and other items to continue keeping it well-stocked. She is grateful for the support Yehu Microfinance and Kiva gives her.

loans.use: to stock her store with beverages, canned and baked goods and other items.

loans.name: Yousf

texts.en:
Yousf is a 30-year-old man who lives with his family in Ibb, Yemen. He is married and has two children. Despite his young age, he is very enthusiastic, entrepreneurial and hardworking. He worked very hard to finish his bachelor’s degree.

Thanks to his entrepreneurial spirit and the money he was able to save, two years ago he set up his own business selling groceries. His wish is to support himself and help his family.

Yousf is applying for a youth loan of 200,000 YER from AMB to be able to buy more grocery items such as rice, sugar, oil, canned food, etc. to stock his store. This will increase his sales and his income so that in the future he can expand his grocery business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries for his store.

loans.name: Helena

texts.pt:
Casada e mãe de 5 filhos destes 3 vão a Escola, vive na casa própria e sustenta 2 netos que vivem com ela. 	
É auxiliar de enfermagem no centro de saúde local, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar produtos (arroz, farinha, açúcar, feijão, massas, caldos e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja fazer crescer o seu negócio e abrir um armazém de produtos, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo devidamente para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é a baixa da demanda no inverno.
texts.en: Helena is married and is the mother of 5 children, 3 of whom go to school.  She lives in her own home and also supports 2 grandchildren who live with her.  She is a nursing assistant at the local health center.  She will use this loan to buy products (rice, flour, sugar, beans, dough, soups, etc.) to increase her quantity of merchandise.  In the future, she hopes to grow her business and open a general store.  To do this, she promises to make her payments on time so she can request more loans from Hluvuku.  Her challenge is the lower demand during the winter.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, sugar, beans, dough, soup, etc.)

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is married and has three children. He operates a retail shop in a competitive business environment with reliable customers. He has been in the business for two years and has one employee. 

Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has improved his savings plan because he has been trained on financial management. He hopes to expand his business in the future. He needs a loan of 15,000 KES to buy milk, bread and soft drinks for resell.

loans.use: To buy milk, bread and soft drinks.

loans.name: Yanor

texts.en:
Yanor, 50, is married, and has four children aged 28, 25, 20 and 14 years. In 1996 Yanor started selling fish so as to raise money to support her children. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about 900,000 SLL every month.

Yanor would like a 3,000,000 SLL loan through ARD to increase her stock of fish and so her income as well. In the future she plans to build a house.

Yanor thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to increase her stock of fish for more profit.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en: Consolata is a hard-working businesswoman who sells maize to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years and has three employees. She also operates a cafeteria and sells charcoal to generate extra income. She previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped her grow her business. She dreams of owning a piece of land to grow maize and wants to buy a lorry for easy transportation of her cereals. She is requesting a loan of 45,000 KES to buy maize for resale.

loans.use: To buy maize to resell

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam, age 30, is the mother of four dependent children who are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a village located in the Likoni District. She sells charcoal in the neighborhood and her husband is a businessman. In order to support her family, she has been in this business for almost two years. She now can earn a monthly income of up to Ksh 4,000 from her current business. In addition, sometimes, they work for others to earn additional income.

Mariam has been with Yehu for months. She is requesting another loan of Ksh 10,000 with Yehu, she plans to use the loan to buy sacks of charcoal for her business. She hopes to increase her business, earn more income and send her four children to high school when they complete primary education .

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Filipe

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 2 filhos que vão a Escola, vive na casa própria e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É docente e quadro do Ministério da Educação, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (areia, cimento, portas, janelas, blocos e outros) para dar continuidade com a sua casa.
No futuro deseja continuar com os seus estudos e iniciar uma actividade comercial, para tal compromete-se a pagar o empréstimo devidamente para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é o elevado custo de vida e o elevado preço do material no mercado local.
texts.en: Filipe is married and is the father of two children who go to school.  He lives in his own home and doesn't support anyone besides his immediate family.  He is a teacher and part of the Ministry of Education.  He will use this loan to buy construction materials (sand, cement, doors, windows, bricks, etc.) to continue work on his home.  In the future, he hopes to continue with his studies and to start a business.  To do this, he promises to make his payments on time so he can request more loans in the future from Hluvuku.  His challenge is the elevated cost of living and prices of materials in the local market.

loans.use: to buy construction mateirals (sand, cement, doors, windows, bricks, etc.)

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 29 years old. She is a hardworking lady who sells used shoes in order to earn a living. She employs one person in her business. 

She previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped her grow her business. She has also been able to expand her business because she has been trained on financial management. She needs a loan of 80,000 KES to buy more shoes for resale.

loans.use: To buy more shoes.

loans.name: Dominic

texts.en:
Dominic is 24 years old, single and supporting two siblings. He runs a local video show room where he offers entertainment to the locals. He started this business six years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

He has requested his first loan of KES 30,000 in order to purchase a DSTV disc which will allow him to show more programs. The anticipated profit from his business will help him save for the future. He hopes to become a great entrepreneur.

loans.use: To purchase a DSTV disc to show more programs.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid, 37, lives with his partner, Amina, in the city of Mombasa. They both work in the retail trade. Rashid has a well-stocked store where he sells vegetables, fruit, consumer staples, drinks and dairy products. Rashid is a self-sacrificing person who works hard each day to get ahead and improve his quality of life.

Rashid will use this loan to buy vegetables, fruit, potatoes, etc. He thanks Yehu microfinance and Kiva for the assistance that he is receiving.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruit, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Andres Corsino

texts.es: El Sr. Andrés  tiene 31 años, tiene dos hijos que son de las edades de seis y un año, vive en  la zona de las Lomas, se dedica a la fabricación de muebles metálicos de hace 4 años,  su taller se encuentra en su propio domicilio, esta es la única fuente de ingreso que tiene el Sr. para mantener a su familia , el crédito que está solicitando es para comprar materiales para la construcción de un techo para un tinglado, esta  época se ha incrementado su demanda, y por ende ha aumentado sus clientes con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien, El Sr. Andrés es una persona trabajadora, que se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo que se le ha brindado.
texts.en: Mr. Andrew is 31 years old and has two children who are six and one year old.  He lives in the area of Las Lomas and has devoted himself to the manufacture of metal furniture for the last four years.  His studio is within his home.  This is the only source of income he has to support his family.  The loan he is requesting is to buy materials to construct the roof of a shed.  Time has brought about increased demand, and he was able to increase his customers with the previous loan which served him well.   Mr. Andrew is a hard worker who is grateful to the institution for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to construct the roof of a shed.

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is a 28-year-old single Lebanese woman. She lives with her parents and two working siblings. She and her father manage the family’s expenses alongside the large support of her siblings. 

Dalal works very hard in order to bring additional income to her family.  She has been working as a beautician for five years. She has a fair number of loyal customers who request her services. In order to avoid rent expenses, she decided to start working from home where many customers from her community visit her to obtain her services at low prices. 

Today, she is requesting a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l so that she can expand her product offerings and buy new beauty supplies. She would like to earn greater income and she believes that the loan will help her achieve her goals. One of her greatest dreams is to get married and have children; she’s working hard in order save for her wedding.

loans.use: to expand her product offerings and to buy new beauty supplies.

loans.name: Jemimah

texts.en:
Jemimah is 25 years old. She earns a living as a tailor. She has been in the business for four years and has two employees. In addition, she operates a beauty shop to generate extra income. Previously, she worked in agriculture. 

Through Faulu Kenya, she has been able to successfully operate another business because she has been trained on business management. She hopes to expand her business in five years. She needs a loan of 20,000 KES in order to buy fabric and thread for sewing.

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread for sewing.

loans.name: Sugey

texts.es:
Sugey
Puntarenas
1000000

	Sugey tiene 32 años y vive con sus hermanos y su padrastro,  Se presenta como una persona trabajadora, responsable y con metas trazadas, ante la muerte de su madre, ella se ha responsabilizado por la educación de su hermano menor, apoyando así a su padrastro quien trabaja de día en el comercio y en la noche se dedican a atender un negocio, que es una venta de comidas rápidas.

	 La clienta  es independiente y tiene su negocio de comercio vendiendo perfumes, ropa y además administra  una oficina de pago de servicios y recarga de celulares. Su sueño es fortalecer su negocio, crecer y tener distribución de productos por toda la zona de Puntarenas. 

	Inició en el comercio con un préstamo de la empresa Cruz de Amor (quien la recomienda como una excelente vendedora), al ir adquiriendo capital ha mantenido su negocio y diversificando sus actividades, después de la muerte de su madre, su tía le ha apoyado y ha aumentado su clientela en la zona. También es recomendada por una de las integrantes del Banco Mujer Creciendo Juntas quienes le compran artículos a Sugey.

 	La actividad cuenta con una clientela fija, tiene recuperación semanal en lo que respecta a la ropa y perfumes, y diaria con el pago de servicios, que le ha venido a contribuir más para el apoyo a la familia. 

    Apoya a su familia (educación de hermanastro) y busca la forma de diversificar y ofrecer otros servicios que le generen ingresos para el núcleo familiar. 

     La solicitante presenta muy buenas referencias, su negocio le permite apoyar  a su familia, después del fallecimiento de su madre. Los vecinos y familiares reconocen su esfuerzo.
texts.en:
Sugey is 32 years old and lives with her siblings and her stepfather. She is a hardworking and responsible person who has set clear goals for herself. Faced with the death of her mother, she has taken on responsibility for her younger brother’s education. It is her way of supporting her stepfather, who works during the day in retail. At night the family runs a business selling fast food.

This entrepreneur is independent. She has her retail business selling perfumes and clothing; she also runs an office where she accepts payments for services and reloads credit onto cell phones. Her dream is to strengthen and grow her business and to distribute her products throughout the Puntarenas area. 

She started in retail with a loan from the business Cruz de Amor, which recommends her as an excellent salesperson. As she has acquired capital she has maintained her business. She has diversified her business activity since the death of her mother. Her aunt has helped her and she has succeeded in growing her clientele. She is also recommended by one of the members of the Banco Mujer Creciendo Juntas (the women's bank "Growing Together"); the members of the group buy goods from Sugey.

 Sugey’s business boasts a steady and stable client base. She recovers her costs in the clothing and perfume sales weekly, and recovers her costs with the payment of services business daily. Her profitability has allowed her to contribute more to the support of her family. She is pleased to support the education of her stepbrother and is looking for a way to further diversify her business activity and offer additional services that will generate income for her family.  

     Sugey is applying for this loan with very good references. Her business has allowed her to contribute to the family after the loss of her mother. Her neighbors and family recognize her efforts.

loans.use: To buy perfume, clothing and other personal products to sell.

loans.name: Ngome

texts.en:
Ngome is 40 years old, married and has six children. He is a very hard-working and tenacious man; he always makes an effort to get ahead in life.

He runs a well-supplied small store. Ngome told us he started working in this field more than a year ago because there was a need for a general store in his neighborhood. Little by little he has been able to grow this business thanks to his job.

He is requesting a loan to buy more general products such as rice, noodles, flour, sugar, oil and other products. Thanks to this investment, he continues to sell high quality products, consequently increasing his sales and his income.

loans.use: to buy more general products such as rice, noodles, flour, sugar and oil.

loans.name: Amos

texts.en:
Amos is 24 years old. He sells phone accessories to earn a living. He describes his immediate business environment as good with reliable customers. He has been in the business for two years. 

Through Faulu Kenya, he has improved his saving skills because he has been trained on financial management. He dreams of expanding his business and opening another outlet in a different location. He needs a loan of 10,000 KES to buy phone accessories.

loans.use: To buy phone accessories.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther used her previous loan to buy potato seeds and fertilizer for planting in her farm. She also used part of it to pay some employees. It was profitable and she was able to pay the loan successfully and in good time.

She plans to use this loan to buy fertilizer and potato seeds for planting during this rainy season. With the anticipated income, she plans to expand her farm by planting more cash crops such as beans.

In the future, Esther hopes to invest more in her farming business and make more income in order to improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and potato seeds.

loans.name: Shadrack

texts.en: Shadrack is 55 years old and married with four children. He sells clothes in a competitive business environment with reliable customers. He has employed two people in his business. He had previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya, which helped him grow his business. He dreams of having a stable business in five years. He needs a loan of 50,000 KES to buy more clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is 30 years old, married, with three children. He sells iron sheets to earn a living. He has been in the business for eleven years and has three employees. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save because he has been trained in financial management. He dreams of expanding his business and becoming a contractor in the future. He needs a loan of 20,000 KES to buy iron sheets.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets for construction.

loans.name: Morris

texts.en: Morris is a tailor. He has been in the business for seventeen years and has one employee. In addition to this, he is employed as a caretaker of some rental houses. Since he became a client of Faulu Kenya, he has been trained in how to manage his business. He hopes to open another outlet in a different location in the future. He currently needs a loan of 100,000 KES to buy fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 27-year-old married Lebanese woman. She lives with her husband and three children. Two of her children are still attending school. 

Her husband is past the age of 64, so she decided to manage his car repair business that he has owned for many years. She handles tasks such as the business expenses, returns, appointments etc. Her husband assists her with the work. 

Even though they are content, they suffer from a bad financial situation so Mariam's requesting a youth loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l. She is requesting this loan in order to improve their business by purchasing mechanic tools. She anticipates that by purchasing these tools her income will increase by a minimum of 20%. 

She works all the time because she is responsible for paying study fees for her children. In the near future, Mariam needs a break from the business and some rest so she has to act fast to get the business in good shape, so that she can allow her son to handle the business, and maybe hire new employees.

loans.use: to improve their business by purchasing the needed mechanic tools.

loans.name: Mujeres De Valor Group

texts.es: Eloisa es miembro del Grupo Solidario Mujeres de Valor, tiene 31 años de edad, es casada  y tiene 3 hijos, su esposo trabaja la albañilería. El negocio lo comenzó en el año 2010 con una pequeña pulpería, cuando gano la lotería decidió invertirlo todo para iniciar su negocio, lo abre a las 7:00 AM y lo cierra a las 8:00 PM, la ventaja que tiene es que no hay negocios cercanos y tiene poca competencia. Eloisa solicita este préstamo para invertirlo en la compra de productos como ser: manteca, embutidos, pollo, refrescos, azúcar, frijoles, arroz, entre otros. Los desafíos que enfrenta Eloisa en el negocio son porque cada día los precios de la canasta básica es más cara y las personas casi no compran como antes. El negocio cambiara con el préstamo ya que tendrá más variedad de productos y así venderá más. Las metas de Eloisa es poder sacar a sus hijos adelante, ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar,  que un día su negocio sea mas grande y productivo y tener una mejor calidad de vida. Es el primer crédito que solicita en FAMA y espera cumplir puntualmente con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Eloisa is a member of the group of entrepreneurs known as Women of Courage. She is 31 years old and  married with 3 children. Her husband works as a bricklayer. Her business started in 2010 when she won the lottery and decided to invest all of her winnings in the launch of her own business, a small convenience store. She opens the store at 7:00 AM and closes it at 8:00 PM. The advantage she has in her business is that there are no nearby businesses; she has little competition. Eloisa is requesting this loan in order to invest it in the purchase of products such as lard, sausages, chicken, soft drinks, sugar, beans and rice, among other products. The challenges Eloisa faces result from the fact that people are buying less these days, due to the rising price of basic groceries. The business will change with this loan since she will be able to offer a wider variety of products and will be able to sell more as a result. Her goals are to be able to help her children move ahead, to help her husband with the household expenses, to grow her business so that it is larger and more productive, and to improve her quality of life. This is the first loan that Eloisa has requested from Kiva’s partner FAMA. She expects to punctually make the payments on her loan.

loans.use: To buy basic grocery products.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is 33 years old, married, with two children.  He lives in Ibb, Yemen.  He is a hardworking man. 
He has had a house for ten years. He wants to provide to his children with a good education. He requests a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to buy construction materials.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Jeremiah

texts.en:
Jeremiah is 25 years old and has been farming in his rural home in Litein for six years, producing milk, which he sells to Kenya Cooperative Creameries, and maize, which he sells to the local market. He is married with two children, aged one and three years. He also runs a retail business in the local market for additional income.

Jeremiah has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Kiva partner Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds. He says the venture into poultry farming will improve his farming income and make life better for his entire family. He plans to have at least three dairy cows in the future.

Jeremiah points to poor markets for farm produce as his major challenge.

loans.use: to buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Gs Manantial De Vida Group

texts.es:
La señora María Yolanda de 41 años de edad, vive con su conyugue y sus cinco hijos en su casa de habitación ubicada en San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras se dedica desde hace varios años al negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas.
Sus compañeros de grupo la han elegido como la líder de su grupo por su responsabilidad.
Doña María Yolanda solicita el préstamo para la compra de maíz y leña que son la materia prima que necesita para elaborar las tortillas, con el apoyo de este préstamo ella mejorara sus ingresos y comprara lo que necesita para seguir trabajando. Al igual que doña Maria Félix  que tiene su  molino y doña Maria Elena que se dedica a la venta de tamales y tacos.
El sueño de doña Maria Yolanda es mejorar su casa, para mejorar las condiciones de vida de ella y su familia.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
Mrs. María Yolanda is 41 years old, lives with her spouse and her five children in her house that is located in San Lorenzo in the south of Honduras where she has worked for several years making and selling tortillas. Her group members have elected her as their leader because of her responsibility. Mrs. María Yolanda is asking for a loan to purchase corn and firewood, which are essential to making tortillas, with the help of this loan, she will improve her earnings and purchase what she needs in order to continue working. Also, Mrs. María Felix has her own mill and Mrs. María Elena sells tamales and tacos. Mrs. María Yolanda's dream is to improve her house in order to improve her family's living conditions. 
San Lorenzo, Honduras-June 2012.

loans.use: purchase corn and firewood.

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Basma is a 47-year-old housewife with a big family of nine sons and daughters. However, Basma is not a traditional housewife, but a practical and ambitious business woman. She owns a small business making dresses and doing traditional dress embroidery. She has started to teach her daughters the business so they may help her and follow in her footsteps.

Basma's success in her small business is reflected by how much her products have spread throughout the market and in how many exhibitions she participates. She has done quite well so far.

Now she has applied for a loan to buy a new sewing machine for her daughter in order to increase her productivity. And she hopes in the future to rent a small place next to her house and turn it into a sewing and embroidery workshop where she can employ more of the neighborhood’s housewives.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 49 years old and married. She operates a grocery store in a competitive environment with readily available customers. She has been in the business for six years. 

She has previously acquired a loan from Faulu Kenya which helped her to grow her business. She hopes to expand her business and add more stock in five years. She needs a loan of 60,000 KES to buy vegetables and tomatoes.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and tomatoes.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 28 years old, married and has 5 children. She is a very hard-working and tenacious; she is always making efforts to get ahead in life.

She runs a well-supplied small store. Christine told us she started working in this field more than 10 years ago because there was a need for a general store in her neighborhood. Little by little she has been able to grow this business thanks to her job.

She is requesting a loan to buy more general products such as rice, noodles, flour, sugar, oil and other products. Thanks to this investment, she will continue to sell high quality products, consequently increasing her sales and her income.

loans.use: to buy more general products such as rice, noodles, flour, sugar, oil and other products.

loans.name: Ingrid Elizabeth

texts.es:
La Señora Ingrid es una persona muy trabajadora dedicado 100% a su trabajo. Actualmente vive con su esposo en el municipio del marcovia departamento de Choluteca. Y Se dedica a su negocio propio venta de achinería.
Doña Ingrid el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de collares, cortaúñas, diademas, aritos, argollas, pulsera. Este tipo de mercadería se vende en el verano. Doña Ingrid espera que al finalizar la temporada de verano pueda tener un buen capital y bastante producto. Ya que es una zona muy productiva y comercial. Y así tener más mercadería y de esta manera poder crecer con este tipo de negocio.
Doña Ingrid desea Seguir trabajando muy fuerte para poder ayudar a su familia especialmente a su madre y hermanos.
Choluteca, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
Ms. Ingird is a hard working person who is 100% dedicated to her work. She currently lives with her husband in the town of Marcovia in the region of Choluteca. She works selling accessories. Ms. Ingird is asking for a loan in order to purchase necklaces, nail clippers, headbands, rings and bracelets. She sells this kind of merchandise in the summer. Ms. Ingrid hopes that when the summer ends she will have savings and enough product. The area is already very productive and commercial. And so, having more merchandise will help her to grow her business. Mrs. Ingrid hopes to continue working very hard in order to help her family, especially her mother and siblings.
Choluteca, Honduras-June 2012.

loans.use: purchase necklaces, nail clippers, headbands, hoops, rings and bracelets.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is married with two children, one of whom is in school. She lives in her own house that has piped water but no electricity. Fatuma has customers from various locations, the majority being from the city of Mombasa.

Fatuma tells us that she wants to be able to keep helping her family through her job, so she always puts in all her effort. Her goal is to continue to grow and to open a retail shop in the future. She is requesting a loan to buy sacks of cashew nuts to sell.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cashew nuts for sale.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 48-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married and lives with his wife and five children. One of them is working and the others are still studying. His youngest child is working in order to supplement the family income. Hussein is the one responsible for covering his children’s expenses and above all improving their standards of living. 

He has been working as an electrician for twelve years. He works independently and has a great relationship with a fair number of clients as well. Today, he’s requesting a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l in order to purchase electrical supplies for his business. In that way, he will be able to take on more projects and therefore increase his earnings. He’s an ambitious man who always seeks to improve his family’s life by seeking to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase the needed electrical supplies for his business.

loans.name: Cyprian

texts.en:
Cyprian is a resident of Nkubu in central Kenya where he lives with his family of three children, whose ages are between 15 and 4 years and all of whom are in school. Cyprian is forty years old and has been active in farming for fourteen years, mainly producing milk and coffee, which he sells at the local market.

Cyprian has requested a loan of 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to construct feed storage. He believes that this will help him handle the storage of the feed for his dairy cows, which in turn will improve the milk production and boost his farming income. Increasing his farming income will help in educating his children.
 
Cyprian is very grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for providing loans to farmers but laments the poor market for his produce.

loans.use: To construct feed storage.

loans.name: Lidia Azucena

texts.es:
La Señora Lidia es una persona muy trabajadora dedicada a su trabajo. Actualmente vive con su esposo en el departamento de Choluteca Honduras.
Doña Lidia se dedica a su negocio propio que es la fábrica y venta de tortillas y venta de comida. El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de maíz, leña, cal, carnes y condimentos.
Doña Lidia espera que al finalizar la temporada de verano pueda tener un buen capital y bastante producto. Ya que es una zona muy productiva y comercial.
Doña Lidia es una señora muy perseverante a pesar de que es un adulto mayor seguirá trabajando muy duro para poder ayudar a sus hijos y su familia.
Choluteca, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
Mrs. Lidia is a hard working woman, dedicated to her job. She currently lives with her husband in the region of Choluteca, Honduras. Mrs. Lidia works making and selling tortillas as well as food. The loan is needed to purchase corn, firewood, lime, meats and condiments. Mrs. Lidia hopes that when the summer ends she will have savings and enough product. The area is already very productive and commercial. Mrs. Lidia is a perseverant woman, despite being an older woman,she will continue working very hard in order to help her children and family.
Choluteca, Honduras-June 2012

loans.use: purchase corn, firewood, lime, meats and condiments.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 38 years old and married. He operates a posho mill in a conducive environment with reliable customers. He has been in the business for 10 years and has one employee. Previously, he used to operate a handcart transport business. Through Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save because he has been trained in financial management. He hopes to open five more outlets of his business in the future. He needs a loan of 50,000 KES to buy maize.

loans.use: To buy maize

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is a 28-year-old single mother; her child is three years old. She cooks and sells food. She started this business eight years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000.

She has requested her first loan of KES 20,000 to purchase more utensils and Meko brand gas for efficient services. 

The profit earned from the business will help her repay her loan and save the remaining amount. Her dream is to provide her children with a high level of education.

loans.use: To purchase Meko brand gas and utensils.

loans.name: Jenan

texts.en: Jenan, a 44-year-old housewife, is married to an accountant. In order to help support the family, Jenan began a small retail business at home, selling cosmetics and some accessories. She has requested a loan in order to increase the quantity of cosmetics products she has for sale so that she can open her own store in the near future.

loans.use: to increase her stock of cosmetics products for sale.

loans.name: Phork

texts.en:
Phork is 25 years old, married and the mother of two young kids. She lives with her husband and children in the Baray District of Kompong Tom Province. She works as a farmer, cultivating various kinds of crops on her own farmland. She grows rice, beans and vegetables for sell. Her husband helps her in the business and also dedicates time to the animal trading business. Her husband is the main income provider of the family. 

To help her husband in his business, Phork decided to ask for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase cows for trading purpose. She believes that this investment will increase profits for the business. She hopes that lenders will continue to help her family go further in their business ventures. With the increase in income, Phork will reinvest in the business and save a portion of it for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase cows for trading purpose.

loans.name: José Aristides

texts.es:
Don José tiene 48 años de edad, es casado. Es el segundo hijo de cinco en total, a la edad de 20 años de edad, comenzó a trabajar por su propia cuenta. Inicio como jornalero, en ese trabajo adquirió mucha experiencia, pero no le era suficiente ya que tenia muchas necesidades económicas, después empezó como ayudante en un autobús, al pasar unos meses obtuvo el trabajo de cobrador en ese autobús, como su conducta era buena se gano la confianza del dueño del autobús y al año y medio se convirtió en el motorista del autobús; de esa manera sus ingresos mejoraron considerablemente. Poco tiempo después conoció a quien es su esposa actualmente, ya que viajaba en el autobús, ya tiene 12 años de casado, según manifiesta el señor son felices y viven una vida plena y dice que si Dios permite tener un bebe su felicidad será aún mayor.
Ellos son unas excelentes personas, muy responsables. Actualmente solicita un préstamo para comprar dos vacas lecheras, para que aprovechen el pasto que tiene en su terreno. La inversión se realizara con el objetivo de tener una fuente de productividad en su familia y a la vez generando un ingreso más. Lo que desea es mejorar su economía y sentirse satisfecho de que la institución le confía ese capital por su buena moral de pago. En sus metas esta el dejar de trabajar como motorista y dedicarse a las actividades pecuarias de ganado y cerdos, ya que es una actividad más liviana y rentable a la vez.
texts.en:
Don José is 48 years old and is married. He is the second child of five and at 20 years of age he began to work for himself. He began as a laborer and got a lot of experience in this line of work but it was not sufficient because he had greater economic needs. After that, he began as an assistant on a bus and after some months earned the job of driving the bus. Because of his good driving he won the owner's confidence and became after a year and a half the driver of this bus. In this way, his income improved considerably.

Shortly after, he met who is now his wife because she used to take this bus. They now have been married twelve years. According to his own statements, he is happy and they live a full life, saying that if God allows them to have a baby his happiness will be even greater. 

They are both excellent and very responsible people. Currently he is requesting a loan to buy two milk cows in order to take advantage of the pasture that his land has. The investment will be utilized to make a productive source for his family and at the same time to generate more income. What he hopes is to improve his economic situation and to feel satisfied that the institution trusts him with the money because of his ability to pay back. Among his goals is to leave his job as a driver and make a living working with cattle and pigs because this is light and profitable work.

loans.use: to buy two milk cows.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 38-year-old Lebanese man. He’s married to Safiya, a beautiful young woman. They have only one child who is still attending school. Abbas is a great man who loves his family and really would like to offer them a respectable life. He works nonstop, on his own, to be able to cover their expenses. 

He has been working as a plumber for fifteen years. He’s an honest man and above all punctual which is the reason his customers are loyal to him. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional plumbing tools for his business. This Kiva loan will facilitate his business operations and allow him start his new project properly. Abbas works to collect higher revenues so that he can educate his son at an excellent school so that his son can have a very comfortable life -- away from hardworking.

loans.use: to purchase additional plumbing tools for his business.

loans.name: Rosa Maritza

texts.es:
La señora Rosa tiene 39 años de edad y tres hijos. Ella cuenta con seis años de experiencia en administrar su propia tienda; antes solo se ocupaba de realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa. Los productos que necesita para su tienda los compra en la ciudad que esta a veinte minutos en autobús de su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar productos de primera necesidad y aumentar el inventario de su tienda. Con el objetivo de incrementar sus ventas, las cuales le permitan mejorar su nivel de vida (alimentación, salud, vestuario). De las ganancias de su negocio, ella pretende pagar el estudio de sus hijos, para que puedan salir adelante con su educación y realizarse mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en: Mrs. Rosa is 39 years old and has three children. She has six years experience running her own store: before she was only responsible for taking care of the home. The products that she needs for her store she buys in the city that is 20 minutes away from her house by bus. The loan she is asking for from Fundación Campo is to purchase basic necessities and increase her store's stock. With the objective of increasing sales, which will allow her to improve her standard of living (food, health, clothing). With the earnings from her business, she will try to pay for her children's schooling, so that they can continue with their education and also to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: purchase basic necessities and increase her store's stock.

loans.name: Norma Jamileth

texts.es:
La Señora Norma es una persona muy trabajadora dedicada a su trabajo. Actualmente vive con su esposo en el departamento de Choluteca.
Doña Norma se dedica a su negocio propio que es la venta de semilla de maní o cacahuate. El préstamo lo necesita para la compra de semilla de maní y de morro.
Doña Norma espera que al finalizar la temporada de verano logre tener un buen capital y bastante producto. Ya que es una época muy productiva y comercial. Y a si tener más mercadería y de esta manera poder crecer con este tipo de negocio para salir a venderlo a otras zonas.
Doña Norma seguirá trabajando muy duro para poder ayudar a su familia especialmente a sus hijos.
Choluteca, Honduras - Junio del 2012
texts.en:
Mrs. Norma is a hard working person dedicated to her job. She currently lives with her husband in the region of Choluteca. Mrs. Norma works at her own business selling peanut and morro seeds (from the Crescentia alata plant species, traditionally used to make a drink called horchata in El Salvador) . The loan is needed to purchase peanut and morro seeds. Mrs. Norma hopes that at the end of the summer she will have working capital and enough product. The area is already productive and commercial. And so having more merchandise can help her to grow her business and then she will be able to branch out into other zones. Mrs. Norma will continue working very hard in order to help her family, especially her children.
Choluteca, Honduras-June 2012

loans.use: purchase peanut seeds and morro seeds.

loans.name: Marina Elizabeth

texts.es:
La señora Marina tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo. Ella cuenta con cinco años de experiencia en administrar su propia tienda; antes solo se ocupaba de realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa. Los productos que necesita para su tienda los compra cada fin de semana en la ciudad por mayoreo. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para aumentar el inventario de su tienda y ofrecer mayor diversidad de productos a sus clientes. Al mismo tiempo que espera aumentar sus ingresos económicos para cubrir sus necesidades y las de su familia. Ella espera que su negocio siga creciendo para realizarle unas mejoras a su vivienda para que su hijo tenga una vivienda digna.
texts.en:
Marina is 28 years old. She is married and has a son. She has five years experience managing her own store. Previously she only did housework in her home. She buys the products she needs at her store wholesale every weekend in the city.   

The loan she is asking for from the Fundación Campo is to increase the inventory in her store and offer a wider variety of products to her customers. She also hopes to increase her income to cover her and her family´s necessities. She hopes that her business will keep growing to make some improvements on her home so her son can have a worthy home.

loans.use: to increase the inventory in her store and offer a wider variety of products to her customers.

loans.name: Mayra Cecilia

texts.es: Mayra de Playas se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos, empezó su negocio hace 2 años con la venta de ropa la cual le ayudo con el dinero suficiente para empezar la crianza de pollos y cerdos. A Mayra le gustan mucho los animales por lo que cambio el negocio de ropa para dedicarse por completo a la crianza ya que se dio cuenta que daba mejores resultados aunque requiere más paciencia. Como la casa donde vive es propia y tiene mucho espacio por lo cual ambiento un corral adecuado para sus animales y como está lejos de la ciudad no molesta con el ruido a ningún vecino. Lo que es el cuidado, limpieza y alimentación de estos animales lo realiza sola todo el día todos los días saliendo únicamente dos días a la semana a vender ofreciendo el producto hasta terminar.
